comments.author: kevin@multiblah.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When you 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Pearl Crescent Page Saver Add-on: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/pagesaver/
2. When installed, try put the Add-on's icon in the top right area of the chrome, beside the down arrow.
3. Open multiple tabs.
Actual Results:  
Visual error are created in the tabs. (Confirmed on OSX, on multiple machines)

Expected Results:  
Tabs should behave as normal.

Add=ons should not be able to break the UI like this.
comments.creator: kevin@multiblah.com

comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: This happens when the extension has an icon that is taller than the the tab bar. I've seen this with User Agent Switcher as well.
comments.author: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: This happens when the extension has an icon that is taller than the the tab bar. I've seen this with User Agent Switcher as well.

comments.text: *** Bug 638717 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
comments.author: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: I'm not sure if we can set a max height for the tab bar.
comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: I'm not sure if we can set a max height for the tab bar.
